title: Covered Jar
text: Made in imitation of a ritual bronze vessel, this high-fired stoneware is unglazed except for some accidental splashes of green glaze on the lid. Throughout the Chou period, high-fired, impressed stoneware continued to be refined, especially in the lower reaches of the Yangtze and the southeastern provinces. For many years, the glazed and unglazed stonewares remained similar in technique and decoration. By eastern Chou, glazed wares became more numerous and, by the Warring States (475-221 b.c.) era, about half of all ceramics were glazed.
creditline: Gift of funds from Curtis Dunnavan
